CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canJump(nums)
        ASSIGN 0 TO positionIndex
        ASSIGN 0 TO maximumReach

        WHILE positionIndex LESS THAN LENGTH(nums)
            IF NOT(positionIndex LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO maximumReach)
                OUTPUT false
                EXIT FUNCTION
            END IF

            ASSIGN (positionIndex PLUS nums[positionIndex]) TO candidateReach
            IF candidateReach GREATER THAN maximumReach
                ASSIGN candidateReach TO maximumReach
            END IF

            INCREMENT positionIndex BY 1
        END WHILE

        IF maximumReach GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO (LENGTH(nums) MINUS 1)
            OUTPUT true
            EXIT FUNCTION
        END IF

        OUTPUT false
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            IF i GREATER THAN farthest  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            SET possible_reach TO i PLUS element at position i of nums  
            IF possible_reach GREATER THAN farthest  
                SET farthest TO possible_reach  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        IF farthest GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the LENGTH OF nums MINUS one  
            RETURN true  
        ELSE  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        DECLARE result AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE temp AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE bitmask AS integer  
        DECLARE index AS integer  
        
        IF NOT (n NOT EQUALS 0) THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        SET temp AS grayCode(n - 1)  
        SET bitmask AS 1 << (n - 1)  
        
        SET result AS temp  
        SET index TO LENGTH(temp) - 1  
        
        WHILE index GREATER OR EQUAL TO 0 DO  
            APPEND (temp[index] BITWISE_OR bitmask) TO result  
            DECREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        IF n EQUALS zero  
            RETURN a list containing zero  
        END IF

        SET mask TO one MULTIPLIED BY two RAISED TO the power of n MINUS one  
        SET current_gray TO concatenation of prev_gray WITH a list constructed by taking each number IN the reversed prev_gray AND applying bitwise OR with mask  
        RETURN current_gray  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET length_s AS the LENGTH OF s  
        
        IF NOT (length_s GREATER THAN one)  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET palindrome_flag TO a list of length_s elements each containing a list of length_s elements initialized to FALSE  
        
        SET idx TO zero  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length_s  
            SET palindrome_flag[idx][idx] AS TRUE  
            INCREMENT idx BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET substr_len TO two  
        WHILE substr_len LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s  
            SET start_pos TO zero  
            WHILE start_pos LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s MINUS substr_len  
                SET end_pos TO start_pos PLUS substr_len MINUS one  
                
                IF substr_len EQUALS two THEN  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                ELSE  
                    SET chars_match AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                    SET inner_palindrome AS palindrome_flag[start_pos PLUS one][end_pos MINUS one]  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (chars_match AND inner_palindrome)  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT start_pos BY one  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT substr_len BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET min_cut_counts TO a list of length_s elements initialized as zero  
        
        SET i TO zero  
        WHILE i LESS THAN length_s  
            IF palindrome_flag[zero][i] THEN  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS zero  
            ELSE  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS positive infinity  
                SET j TO one  
                WHILE j LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO i  
                    IF palindrome_flag[j][i] AND ((min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one) LESS THAN min_cut_counts[i]) THEN  
                        SET min_cut_counts[i] AS (min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one)  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN min_cut_counts[length_s MINUS one]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO one  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET is_palindrome TO a two dimensional collection of size n by n filled with FALSE  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            SET element at position i at position i of is_palindrome TO TRUE  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR length FROM two TO n  
            FOR start FROM zero TO n MINUS length  
                SET end TO start PLUS length MINUS one  
                IF length EQUALS two  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s  
                ELSE  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s AND the element at position start PLUS one at position end MINUS one of is_palindrome  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        SET min_cuts TO a collection of size n filled with zero  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF element at position zero at position i of is_palindrome  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO zero  
            ELSE  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO positive infinity  
                FOR j FROM one TO i  
                    IF element at position j at position i of is_palindrome AND element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one LESS THAN element at position i of min_cuts  
                        SET element at position i of min_cuts TO element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position n MINUS one of min_cuts  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        DECLARE polarity AS string  
        IF (numerator < 0 AND denominator >= 0) OR (numerator >= 0 AND denominator < 0) THEN  
            polarity ← "-"  
        ELSE  
            polarity ← ""  
        ENDIF  
  
        numerator ← ABS(numerator)  
        denominator ← ABS(denominator)  
  
        DECLARE integralQuotient AS integer ← numerator DIV denominator  
        DECLARE modValue AS integer ← numerator MOD denominator  
        DECLARE integerString AS string ← TO_STRING(integralQuotient)  
  
        IF modValue = 0 THEN  
            RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString)  
        ENDIF  
  
        DECLARE remainderPositions AS MAP FROM integer TO integer ← EMPTY MAP  
        DECLARE digits AS LIST OF string ← EMPTY LIST  
  
        DECLARE currentRemainder AS integer ← modValue  
        WHILE currentRemainder ≠ 0 DO  
            IF remainderPositions CONTAINS currentRemainder THEN  
                DECLARE cycleStart AS integer ← remainderPositions[currentRemainder]  
                DECLARE prefix AS string ← ""  
                DECLARE suffix AS string ← ""  
                FOR idx FROM 0 TO cycleStart - 1 DO  
                    prefix ← CONCAT(prefix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                FOR idx FROM cycleStart TO LENGTH(digits) - 1 DO  
                    suffix ← CONCAT(suffix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", prefix, "(", suffix, ")")  
            ENDIF  
  
            remainderPositions[currentRemainder] ← LENGTH(digits)  
  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder * 10  
            DECLARE digitValue AS integer ← currentRemainder DIV denominator  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder MOD denominator  
            APPEND TO digits: TO_STRING(digitValue)  
        ENDWHILE  
  
        RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", JOIN(digits))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        IF numerator LESS THAN zero AND denominator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero OR numerator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND denominator LESS THAN zero  
            SET sign TO the string indicating negative  
        ELSE  
            SET sign TO the empty string  
        END IF  
  
        SET numerator TO the absolute value of numerator  
        SET denominator TO the absolute value of denominator  
  
        SET quotient TO the integer division result of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET remainder TO the remainder of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET integer_part TO the string representation of quotient  
  
        IF remainder EQUALS zero  
            RETURN the concatenation of sign and integer_part  
        END IF  
  
        SET seen_remainders TO an empty mapping from remainder values to positions  
        SET fractional_part TO an empty list  
  
        WHILE remainder NOT EQUALS zero  
            IF remainder EXISTS AS a key in seen_remainders  
                SET start TO the value associated with remainder in seen_remainders  
                SET non_repeating TO the concatenation of elements from position zero UP TO position start EXCLUDING start in fractional_part  
                SET repeating TO the concatenation of elements FROM position start TO the end of fractional_part  
                RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, non_repeating, the opening parenthesis string, repeating, and the closing parenthesis string  
            END IF  
  
            ASSIGN to seen_remainders at key remainder the current length of fractional_part  
  
            SET remainder TO remainder MULTIPLIED BY ten  
            SET quotient TO the integer division result of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            SET remainder TO the remainder of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            APPEND the string representation of quotient TO fractional_part  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, and the concatenation of all elements in fractional_part  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        SWITCH  
            CASE n > 2:  
                BREAK  
            DEFAULT:  
                RETURN 0  
        END SWITCH  
        SET primality_flags AS empty list  
        SET counter AS 0  
        WHILE counter IS LESS THAN n DO  
            ADD True TO primality_flags  
            SET counter TO counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET primality_flags[0] TO False  
        SET primality_flags[1] TO False  
        SET max_check AS FLOOR(SQRT(n))  
        SET candidate AS 2  
        WHILE candidate <= max_check DO  
            IF primality_flags[candidate] IS NOT False THEN  
                SET factor AS candidate * candidate  
                WHILE factor < n DO  
                    SET primality_flags[factor] TO False  
                    SET factor TO factor + candidate  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            SET candidate TO candidate + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET tally AS 0  
        FOR element IN primality_flags DO  
            IF element THEN tally ← tally + 1  
        END FOR  
        RETURN tally  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO two  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        SET is_prime TO an empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            APPEND True TO is_prime  
        END FOR  
        SET element at position zero of is_prime TO False  
        SET element at position one of is_prime TO False  
        SET limit TO the integer part of the square root of n  
        FOR start FROM two TO limit PLUS one  
            IF element at position start of is_prime EQUALS True  
                SET multiple TO start MULTIPLIED BY start  
                WHILE multiple LESS THAN n  
                    SET element at position multiple of is_prime TO False  
                    INCREMENT multiple BY start  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET count TO zero  
        FOR each value IN is_prime  
            IF value EQUALS True  
                INCREMENT count BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)  
        INITIALIZE dp AS a list WITH (n + 1) elements EACH SET TO infinity_value  
        ASSIGN dp[0] ← 0  
        INITIALIZE squares AS an empty list  
        ASSIGN counter ← 1  
        LOOP  
            IF (counter * counter) > n THEN EXIT LOOP  
            ADD (counter * counter) TO squares  
            SET counter ← counter + 1  
        END LOOP  
        ASSIGN index ← 1  
        WHILE index ≤ n DO  
            FOR EACH current_square IN squares DO  
                IF current_square > index THEN  
                    EXIT FOR  
                ELSE  
                    TEMP ← dp[index - current_square] + 1  
                    IF TEMP < dp[index] THEN  
                        SET dp[index] ← TEMP  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            SET index ← index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN dp[n]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET dp TO a list of size n PLUS one FILLED WITH infinite value  
        SET the element at position zero of dp TO zero  
        SET squares TO an empty list  
        SET i TO one  
        WHILE i MULTIPLIED BY i IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
            APPEND i MULTIPLIED BY i TO squares  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        FOR i FROM one TO n  
            FOR each square IN squares  
                IF i IS LESS THAN square  
                    BREAK the inner loop  
                END IF  
                SET dp at position i TO the smaller value BETWEEN dp at position i AND dp at position i MINUS square PLUS one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)
        DECLARE char_sets AS empty list
        DECLARE idx1 AS 0
        WHILE idx1 < LENGTH(words)
            DECLARE temp_set AS empty set
            DECLARE pos AS 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(words[idx1])
                SET temp_set TO temp_set UNION { words[idx1][pos] }
                SET pos TO pos + 1
            END WHILE
            APPEND temp_set TO char_sets
            SET idx1 TO idx1 + 1
        END WHILE

        SET highest_product TO 0

        DECLARE first_pointer AS 0
        WHILE first_pointer < LENGTH(words) - 1
            DECLARE second_pointer AS first_pointer + 1
            WHILE second_pointer < LENGTH(words)
                DECLARE intersection_check AS char_sets[first_pointer] INTERSECT char_sets[second_pointer]
                IF LENGTH(intersection_check) = 0 THEN
                    DECLARE candidate_product AS (LENGTH(words[first_pointer]) * LENGTH(words[second_pointer]))
                    IF candidate_product > highest_product THEN
                        SET highest_product TO candidate_product
                    END IF
                END IF
                SET second_pointer TO second_pointer + 1
            END WHILE
            SET first_pointer TO first_pointer + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN highest_product
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)  
        SET cache AS a list containing (amount + 1) copies of (amount + 1)  
        ASSIGN 0 TO cache[0]  

        SET counter TO 1  
        WHILE counter ≤ amount  
            SET currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            FOR each denomination IN coins  
                SET remainder TO counter - denomination  
                IF remainder ≥ 0 THEN  
                    SET candidate TO cache[remainder] + 1  
                    IF candidate < currentMin THEN  
                        ASSIGN candidate TO currentMin  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            ASSIGN currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF cache[amount] ≠ (amount + 1) THEN  
            RETURN cache[amount]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET dpList AS an array of zeros sized n PLUS 1

        SET outerCounter TO 2

            SET currentMax TO 0  
            SET innerCounter TO 1  
            WHILE innerCounter IS LESS THAN outerCounter DO

                        SET currentMax TO firstProduct  
                    CASE currentMax < secondProduct:  
                        SET currentMax TO secondProduct  
                END SWITCH  
                INCREMENT innerCounter BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET dpList[outerCounter] TO currentMax  
            INCREMENT outerCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN dpList[n]  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION frequencySort WITH PARAMETER s  
        DECLARE freqMap AS mapping from character to integer  
        FOR index FROM 0 TO LENGTH(s) - 1 DO  
            SET currentChar TO s[index]  
            IF freqMap DOES NOT CONTAIN currentChar THEN  
                SET freqMap[currentChar] AS 1  
            ELSE  
                SET freqMap[currentChar] TO freqMap[currentChar] + 1  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        DECLARE charList AS list of characters  
        SET charList TO KEYS OF freqMap  

        DECLARE descSortedChars AS list of characters  
        SET descSortedChars TO SORT charList BY (a, b) → (freqMap[b] - freqMap[a])  

        SET outputString TO EMPTY STRING  
        DECLARE iterator AS integer ← 0  
        WHILE iterator < LENGTH(descSortedChars) DO  
            DECLARE ch AS character ← descSortedChars[iterator]  
            DECLARE count AS integer ← freqMap[ch]  
            DECLARE tempString AS string ← EMPTY STRING  
            FOR repeatIndex FROM 1 TO count DO  
                SET tempString ← tempString + ch  
            END FOR  
            SET outputString ← outputString + tempString  
            SET iterator ← iterator + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN outputString  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findMinDifference(timePoints)  
        FUNCTION to_minutes(time)  
            SET components TO EMPTY LIST  
            SET pos TO 0  
            WHILE pos LESS THAN length of time  
                IF time[pos] EQUALS ":"  
                    EXIT WHILE  
                ELSE  
                    ADD time[pos] TO components  
                    SET pos TO pos + 1  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            SET colon_index TO pos  
            
            SET hrs_str TO SUBSTRING of time FROM 0 TO colon_index  
            SET mins_str TO SUBSTRING of time FROM colon_index + 1 TO length of time  
            
            SET hrs_num TO INTEGER parsed from hrs_str  
            SET mins_num TO INTEGER parsed from mins_str  
            RETURN hrs_num * 60 + mins_num  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET minute_values TO EMPTY LIST  
        SET idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length of timePoints  
            ADD to_minutes(timePoints[idx]) TO minute_values  
            SET idx TO idx + 1  
        END WHILE
        
        CALL sort ON minute_values IN ASCENDING ORDER  
        
        SET shortest_gap TO INFINITY  
        SET pointer TO 1  
        WHILE pointer LESS THAN length of minute_values  
            SET gap TO minute_values[pointer] - minute_values[pointer - 1]  
            IF gap < shortest_gap THEN  
                SET shortest_gap TO gap  
            END IF  
            SET pointer TO pointer + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET wrap_gap TO 1440 - minute_values[length of minute_values - 1] + minute_values[0]  
        IF wrap_gap < shortest_gap THEN  
            SET shortest_gap TO wrap_gap  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN shortest_gap  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)  
        DECLARE bracketStrings AS empty list

            INSERT TO bracketStrings THE STRING OF count  
            INCREMENT count BY 1  
        END WHILE

            DECLARE index AS 0  
            DECLARE limit AS n DIV 2  
            WHILE index LESS THAN limit  
                DECLARE leftSide AS bracketStrings AT index  
                DECLARE rightSide AS bracketStrings AT (n - 1 - index)  
                ASSIGN bracketStrings AT index TO "(" + leftSide + "," + rightSide + ")"  
                INCREMENT index BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET n AS n DIV 2  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN bracketStrings AT 0  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION maxDistance(arrays)

        WHILE cursor < LENGTH(arrays)  
            SET segment TO arrays[cursor]

            IF candidate_one > candidate_two THEN

            END IF  

            IF greatest_gap < better_candidate THEN  
                SET greatest_gap TO better_candidate  
            END IF  

            IF baseline_min > segment_minimum THEN  
                SET baseline_min TO segment_minimum  
            END IF  

            IF baseline_max < segment_maximum THEN  
                SET baseline_max TO segment_maximum  
            END IF  

            SET cursor TO cursor + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN greatest_gap  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION judgeSquareSum WITH parameter c  
        SET upperBound AS INTEGER PART OF THE SQUARE ROOT OF c  
        SET lowerBound AS 0  
        LOOP FOREVER  
            IF lowerBound GREATER THAN upperBound THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            SET total AS (upperBound * upperBound) + (lowerBound * lowerBound)  
            SWITCH total COMPARED TO c  
                CASE EQUAL:  
                    RETURN true  
                CASE LESS:  
                    SET lowerBound TO lowerBound + 1  
                CASE GREATER:  
                    SET upperBound TO upperBound - 1  
            END SWITCH  
        END LOOP  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            IF current_sum EQUALS c THEN  
                RETURN true  
            ELSE IF current_sum LESS THAN c THEN  
                INCREMENT left BY one  
            ELSE

            END IF  
        END WHILE

    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canTransform(start parameter, end parameter)  
        INITIALIZE filteredStart AS empty list  
        INITIALIZE posCounter TO 0  
        WHILE posCounter < LENGTH(start parameter) DO  
            ASSIGN currentChar TO start parameter[posCounter]  
            IF NOT (currentChar = 'X') THEN  
                SET filteredStart TO filteredStart CONCATENATED WITH [(currentChar, posCounter)]  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT posCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE filteredEnd AS empty list  
        ASSIGN idxCursor TO 0  
        WHILE idxCursor < LENGTH(end parameter) DO  
            ASSIGN ch TO end parameter[idxCursor]  
            IF ch <> 'X' THEN  
                SET filteredEnd TO filteredEnd + [(ch, idxCursor)]  
            END IF  
            ASSIGN idxCursor TO idxCursor + 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF LENGTH(filteredStart) != LENGTH(filteredEnd) THEN  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex < LENGTH(filteredStart) DO  
            ASSIGN firstTuple TO filteredStart[pairIndex]  
            ASSIGN secondTuple TO filteredEnd[pairIndex]  

            ASSIGN charA TO firstTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posA TO firstTuple[1]  
            ASSIGN charB TO secondTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posB TO secondTuple[1]  

            IF NOT (charA = charB) THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  

            IF charA = 'L' THEN  
                IF posA < posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            ELSE IF charA = 'R' THEN  
                IF posA > posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            END IF  

            SET pairIndex TO pairIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        ASSIGN size TO LENGTH(graph)  
        ASSIGN paint TO ARRAY OF size ELEMENTS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(vertex, shade)  
            paint[vertex] = shade  
            SET index TO 0  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(graph[vertex])  
                ASSIGN adj TO graph[vertex][index]  
                IF paint[adj] == shade THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                ELSE IF paint[adj] == 0 THEN  
                    IF dfs(adj, -shade) == False THEN  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                index = index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter < size  
            IF paint[counter] == 0 THEN  
                IF dfs(counter, 1) == False THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            counter = counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            INCREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[n]  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF NOT (source NOT EQUAL target)  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE busMap AS a new empty mapping DefaultDict of list  
        SET i TO 0  
        WHILE i LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes  
            SET currentRoute TO routes[i]  
            SET j TO 0  
            WHILE j LESS THAN LENGTH OF currentRoute  
                APPEND i TO busMap[currentRoute[j]]  
                SET j TO j PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET i TO i PLUS 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE queue AS an empty double ended queue  
        INITIALIZE visitedBuses AS an empty set  
        INITIALIZE seenStops AS an empty set  

        FOR each busIndex IN busMap[source]  
            ENQUEUE (busIndex, 1) INTO queue  
            INSERT busIndex INTO visitedBuses  
        END FOR  
        INSERT source INTO seenStops  

        WHILE queue IS NOT EMPTY  
            DEQUEUE FROM queue INTO currentBus, currentCount  

            SET k TO 0  
            WHILE k LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes[currentBus]  
                SET currStop TO routes[currentBus][k]  

                IF currStop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN currentCount  
                END IF  

                IF currStop NOT IN seenStops  
                    INSERT currStop INTO seenStops  

                    FOR each nextBus IN busMap[currStop]  
                        IF nextBus NOT IN visitedBuses  
                            INSERT nextBus INTO visitedBuses  
                            ENQUEUE (nextBus, currentCount PLUS 1) INTO queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  

                SET k TO k PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        FOR each bus WITH index bus_index AND route IN routes

        SET bus_queue TO an empty double ended queue

            ADD source TO visited_stops  
        END FOR

            FOR each stop IN the route at position current_bus OF routes

                    RETURN bus_count

                    FOR each next_bus IN the list of buses at stop FROM stop_to_buses

                        END IF  
                    END FOR

            END FOR

            END IF

            SET result TO NULL  
            SET iterator TO candidates.iterator()  
            SET result TO iterator.next()  
            WHILE iterator.hasNext() DO  
                SET current_val TO iterator.next()  
                IF current_val LESS THAN result THEN  
                    SET result TO current_val  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN result  
        ELSE  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION numFactoredBinaryTrees(arr)  
        ASSIGN MODULO_CONST ← (10 ^ 9) + 7  
        SORT arr BY ascending order  
        
        INITIALIZE factorsCount AS empty mapping  
        FOR each element IN arr DO  
            SET factorsCount[element] ← 1  
        END FOR

        WHILE outerIdx < LENGTH(arr) DO  
            SET currentVal ← arr[outerIdx]  
            SET innerIdx ← 0  
            WHILE innerIdx < outerIdx DO  
                SET divisorCandidate ← arr[innerIdx]

                    SET pairedFactor ← currentVal DIV divisorCandidate  
                    IF pairedFactor IN factorsCount THEN  
                        SET product ← factorsCount[divisorCandidate] * factorsCount[pairedFactor]

                    END IF  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT innerIdx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        ASSIGN accumulation ← 0  
        FOR each countValue IN factorsCount DO  
            SET accumulation ← accumulation + countValue  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN accumulation MODULO MODULO_CONST  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

                END IF

                index_counter ← right_marker

                index_counter ← index_counter + 1
            END IF

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shortestPathAllKeys(grid)  
        SET vectors AS the collection of pairs [(1,0), (-1,0), (0,1), (0,-1)]  
        SET height AS LENGTH OF grid  
        SET width AS LENGTH OF grid AT INDEX zero  
        SET origin WITH NO INITIAL VALUE  
        SET total_keys AS 0  
        SET row_idx AS 0  
        WHILE row_idx < height  
            SET col_idx AS 0  
            WHILE col_idx < width  
                IF grid AT row_idx AND col_idx IS '@' THEN  
                    SET origin TO (row_idx, col_idx)  
                ELSE IF 'a' <= grid AT row_idx AND col_idx AND grid AT row_idx AND col_idx <= 'z' THEN  
                    SET total_keys TO total_keys + 1  
                END IF  
                SET col_idx TO col_idx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET row_idx TO row_idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET frontier AS A new deque INITIALIZED WITH [(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0, 0)]  
        SET encountered AS A set WITH {(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0)}  
        
        WHILE NOT EMPTY frontier  
            SET curr_x, curr_y, acquired_keys, step_count TO POP LEFT frontier  
            FOR EACH vector_x, vector_y IN vectors  
                SET next_x TO curr_x + vector_x  
                SET next_y TO curr_y + vector_y  
                
                IF 0 <= next_x AND next_x < height AND 0 <= next_y AND next_y < width THEN  
                    SET cell_value TO grid AT next_x AND next_y  
                    IF cell_value = '#' THEN  
                        CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'A' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'Z' THEN  
                        SET lock_bit TO 1 << (ORD(LOWERCASE cell_value) - ORD('a'))  
                        IF (acquired_keys & lock_bit) = 0 THEN  
                            CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'a' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'z' THEN  
                        SET updated_keys TO (acquired_keys | 1 << (ORD cell_value - ORD 'a'))  
                        IF updated_keys = (1 << total_keys) - 1 THEN  
                            RETURN step_count + 1  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE  
                        SET updated_keys TO acquired_keys  
                    END IF  
                    
                    IF (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) NOT IN encountered THEN  
                        ADD (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) TO encountered  
                        APPEND (next_x, next_y, updated_keys, step_count + 1) TO frontier  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET n TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid  
        SET start TO no value assigned  
        SET num_keys TO zero  
        FOR i FROM zero TO the value m MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO the value n MINUS one  
                IF element at position i of grid at position j EQUALS the character at sign at symbol  
                    SET start TO the pair of values i and j  
                ELSE IF element at position i of grid at position j IS a lowercase letter  
                    INCREMENT num_keys BY one  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        SET queue TO a new double ended queue containing the single element of the tuple of value at position zero of start value at position one of start zero zero  
        SET visited TO a new set containing the single element of the tuple of value at position zero of start value at position one of start zero  
        WHILE queue is not empty  
            SET x y keys steps TO the tuple removed from the front of queue  
            FOR each pair dx dy IN directions  
                SET nx TO x PLUS dx  
                SET ny TO y PLUS dy  
                IF nx IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND nx IS LESS THAN m AND ny IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND ny IS LESS THAN n  
                    SET cell TO element at position nx of grid at position ny  
                    IF cell EQUALS the hash symbol  
                        CONTINUE to next iteration of FOR loop  
                    END IF  
                    IF cell IS an uppercase letter  
                        SET key_needed TO one SHIFTED LEFT BY the Unicode code point of the lowercase form of cell MINUS the Unicode code point of letter a  
                        IF the result of keys AND key_needed EQUALS zero  
                            CONTINUE to next iteration of FOR loop  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    IF cell IS a lowercase letter  
                        SET new_keys TO the result of keys OR one SHIFTED LEFT BY the Unicode code point of cell MINUS the Unicode code point of letter a  
                        IF new_keys EQUALS one SHIFTED LEFT BY num_keys MINUS one  
                            RETURN steps PLUS one  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE  
                        SET new_keys TO keys  
                    END IF  
                    IF the tuple nx ny new_keys IS NOT in visited  
                        ADD the tuple nx ny new_keys TO visited  
                        APPEND the tuple nx ny new_keys steps PLUS one TO queue  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION movesToStamp(stamp string, target string) RETURNS list of integers  
        DEFINE totalStampLen AS LENGTH(stamp)  
        DEFINE totalTargetLen AS LENGTH(target)  
        DEFINE incomingEdges AS ARRAY OF SIZE (totalTargetLen - totalStampLen + 1) FILLED WITH totalStampLen  
        DEFINE processingQueue AS NEW double ended queue (empty)  
        DEFINE adjacencyList AS ARRAY OF SIZE totalTargetLen EACH CONTAINING EMPTY LIST  

        DEFINE outerIndex AS 0  
        WHILE outerIndex LESS THAN (totalTargetLen - totalStampLen + 1)  
            DEFINE innerIndex AS 0  
            REPEAT  
                IF innerIndex EQUALS totalStampLen THEN  
                    BREAK  
                END IF  
                DEFINE currentStampChar AS stamp[innerIndex]  
                IF target[outerIndex + innerIndex] EQUALS currentStampChar THEN  
                    incomingEdges[outerIndex] ← incomingEdges[outerIndex] - 1  
                    IF incomingEdges[outerIndex] EQUALS 0 THEN  
                        processingQueue.APPEND(outerIndex)  
                    END IF  
                ELSE  
                    adjacencyList[outerIndex + innerIndex].APPEND(outerIndex)  
                END IF  
                SET innerIndex TO innerIndex + 1  
            END REPEAT  
            SET outerIndex TO outerIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        DEFINE result AS EMPTY LIST  
        DEFINE visited AS ARRAY OF SIZE totalTargetLen FILLED WITH False  

        FUNCTION processQueue() RETURNS VOID  
            IF processingQueue.IS_EMPTY() THEN RETURN END IF  
            DEFINE currentIndex AS processingQueue.POP_LEFT()  
            result.APPEND(currentIndex)  
            DEFINE idx AS 0  
            WHILE idx LESS THAN totalStampLen  
                DEFINE pos AS currentIndex + idx  
                IF visited[pos] EQUALS False THEN  
                    visited[pos] ← True  
                    FOR EACH sourceIndex IN adjacencyList[pos]  
                        incomingEdges[sourceIndex] ← incomingEdges[sourceIndex] - 1  
                        IF incomingEdges[sourceIndex] EQUALS 0 THEN  
                            processingQueue.APPEND(sourceIndex)  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
                SET idx TO idx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            processQueue()  
        END FUNCTION  

        processQueue()  

        FOR marker IN visited  
            IF marker EQUALS False THEN  
                RETURN EMPTY LIST  
            END IF  
        END FOR

        RETURN REVERSE(result)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET n TO the LENGTH OF target

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION lastSubstring(s)  
        LET lengthVar BE LENGTH OF s  
        LET highestChar BE MAXIMUM CHARACTER IN s  
        LET positions BE AN EMPTY LIST  
        LET index COUNTER TO 0  
        WHILE index < lengthVar DO  
            IF s[index] = highestChar THEN  
                APPEND index TO positions  
            END IF  
            SET index TO index + 1  
        END WHILE  

        LET candidateSubstring BE ""  
        LET posIndex POINTER TO 0  
        WHILE posIndex < LENGTH OF positions DO  
            LET substringStart BE positions[posIndex]  
            LET tempSubstring BE SLICE OF s FROM substringStart TO (LENGTH OF s)  
            IF NOT (candidateSubstring >= tempSubstring) THEN  
                SET candidateSubstring TO tempSubstring  
            END IF  
            SET posIndex TO posIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN candidateSubstring  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maxValueAfterReverse(nums)
        ASSIGN SIZE OF nums TO lengthCounter
        IF NOT (lengthCounter GREATER THAN 2) THEN
            ASSIGN ABS(nums[0] - nums[1]) TO resultVal
            RETURN resultVal
        END IF

        ASSIGN 0 TO sumAbsDiff
        ASSIGN 1 TO idx
        WHILE idx LESS THAN lengthCounter
            ASSIGN sumAbsDiff + ABS(nums[idx] - nums[idx - 1]) TO sumAbsDiff
            ASSIGN idx + 1 TO idx
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN 0 TO edgeMaxGain
        ASSIGN 1 TO pointerA
        WHILE pointerA LESS THAN lengthCounter
            ASSIGN ABS(nums[0] - nums[pointerA]) - ABS(nums[pointerA] - nums[pointerA - 1]) TO candidateGainA
            IF candidateGainA GREATER THAN edgeMaxGain THEN
                ASSIGN candidateGainA TO edgeMaxGain
            END IF
            ASSIGN pointerA + 1 TO pointerA
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN 0 TO pointerB
        WHILE pointerB LESS THAN lengthCounter - 1
            ASSIGN ABS(nums[lengthCounter - 1] - nums[pointerB]) - ABS(nums[pointerB + 1] - nums[pointerB]) TO candidateGainB
            IF candidateGainB GREATER THAN edgeMaxGain THEN
                ASSIGN candidateGainB TO edgeMaxGain
            END IF
            ASSIGN pointerB + 1 TO pointerB
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN +Infinity TO minMaxPair
        ASSIGN -Infinity TO maxMinPair
        ASSIGN 0 TO iteratorC
        WHILE iteratorC LESS THAN lengthCounter - 1
            ASSIGN MAX(nums[iteratorC], nums[iteratorC + 1]) TO currentMaxVal
            IF currentMaxVal LESS THAN minMaxPair THEN
                ASSIGN currentMaxVal TO minMaxPair
            END IF

            ASSIGN MIN(nums[iteratorC], nums[iteratorC + 1]) TO currentMinVal
            IF currentMinVal GREATER THAN maxMinPair THEN
                ASSIGN currentMinVal TO maxMinPair
            END IF
            ASSIGN iteratorC + 1 TO iteratorC
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN MAX(0, 2 * (maxMinPair - minMaxPair)) TO generalMaxGain

        RETURN sumAbsDiff + MAX(edgeMaxGain, generalMaxGain)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION connectTwoGroups(cost)
        SET lengthA AS LENGTH OF cost
        SET lengthB AS LENGTH OF cost[0]

        SET dp AS LIST OF LISTS WITH (lengthA + 1) ROWS AND (2 ^ lengthB) COLUMNS FILLED WITH INFINITY
        dp[0][0] ← 0

        SET outerIndex TO 0
        WHILE outerIndex < lengthA

            WHILE maskIndex < (2 ^ lengthB)
                SET innerIndex TO 0
                WHILE innerIndex < lengthB
                    dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex BITWISE_OR (1 << innerIndex)] ←
                        MINIMUM(
                            dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex BITWISE_OR (1 << innerIndex)],
                            dp[outerIndex][maskIndex] + cost[outerIndex][innerIndex]
                        )
                    innerIndex ← innerIndex + 1
                END WHILE

                SET checkIndex TO 0
                WHILE checkIndex < lengthB
                    IF (maskIndex BITWISE_AND (1 << checkIndex)) ≠ 0 THEN
                        dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex] ←
                            MINIMUM(
                                dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex],
                                dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex BITWISE_XOR (1 << checkIndex)] + cost[outerIndex][checkIndex]
                            )
                    ENDIF
                    checkIndex ← checkIndex + 1
                END WHILE

                maskIndex ← maskIndex + 1
            END WHILE
            outerIndex ← outerIndex + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN dp[lengthA][(2 ^ lengthB) - 1]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumIncompatibility(nums k)  
        LET totalElements ← LENGTH nums  
        LET sizePerSubset ← totalElements DIV k  
        LET elementCounts ← COUNT ELEMENTS IN nums  
        
        FOR countValue IN elementCounts.VALUES  
            IF countValue > k THEN RETURN -1  
        END FOR  
        
        LET incompatibilityMap ← EMPTY DICTIONARY  
        LET maxMask ← (2 POWER totalElements) - 1  
        LET currentMask ← 0  
        
        WHILE currentMask <= maxMask DO  
            LET bitsSet ← COUNT OF BITS SET IN currentMask  
            
            IF bitsSet = sizePerSubset THEN  
                LET collected ← EMPTY LIST  
                LET index ← 0  
                
                WHILE index < totalElements DO  
                    IF (currentMask BITWISE-AND (2 POWER index)) ≠ 0 THEN  
                        collected.APPEND(nums[index])  
                    END IF  
                    index ← index + 1  
                END WHILE  
                
                LET uniqueElements ← SET OF collected  
                IF LENGTH uniqueElements = sizePerSubset THEN  
                    LET maxVal ← MAX OF collected  
                    LET minVal ← MIN OF collected  
                    LET diff ← maxVal - minVal  
                    incompatibilityMap[currentMask] ← diff  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            
            currentMask ← currentMask + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        LET dpArray ← ARRAY OF SIZE (2 POWER totalElements) FILLED WITH INFINITY  
        dpArray[0] ← 0  
        
        FOR maskValue FROM 0 TO maxMask DO  
            IF (COUNT OF BITS SET IN maskValue) MOD sizePerSubset ≠ 0 THEN CONTINUE  
            
            FOR each candidateSubset IN incompatibilityMap.KEYS DO  
                IF (maskValue BITWISE-AND candidateSubset) = candidateSubset THEN  
                    LET attempt ← dpArray[maskValue - candidateSubset] + incompatibilityMap[candidateSubset]  
                    IF attempt < dpArray[maskValue] THEN  
                        dpArray[maskValue] ← attempt  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        LET fullSetMask ← maxMask  
        IF dpArray[fullSetMask] ≠ INFINITY THEN  
            RETURN dpArray[fullSetMask]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION minimumIncompatibility(nums k)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF nums  
        SET subset_size TO n DIVIDED BY k  
        CREATE counter_object AS a COUNT of each element IN nums  
        IF any count IN the VALUES OF counter_object is GREATER THAN k THEN  
            RETURN negative one  
        END IF  
        CREATE empty dictionary subset_incompatibility  
        FOR mask FROM zero TO TWO RAISED TO THE POWER OF n MINUS one  
            SET bit_count TO the NUMBER OF ONES IN the BINARY REPRESENTATION OF mask  
            IF bit_count EQUALS subset_size THEN  
                CREATE empty list elements  
                FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
                    IF the BITWISE AND OF mask AND TWO RAISED TO THE POWER OF i is NOT EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                        APPEND element at position i OF nums TO elements  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
                IF the NUMBER OF UNIQUE ELEMENTS IN elements EQUALS subset_size THEN  
                    SET incompatibility TO the MAXIMUM ELEMENT IN elements MINUS the MINIMUM ELEMENT IN elements  
                    ASSIGN incompatibility TO subset_incompatibility AT key mask  
                END IF  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        CREATE list dp WITH LENGTH TWO RAISED TO THE POWER OF n FILLED WITH infinity  
        SET dp AT position zero TO zero  
        FOR mask FROM zero TO TWO RAISED TO THE POWER OF n MINUS one  
            IF the REMAINDER OF the NUMBER OF ONES IN the BINARY REPRESENTATION OF mask DIVIDED BY subset_size IS NOT EQUAL TO zero THEN

                    SET candidate_value TO dp AT position mask MINUS subset_mask PLUS subset_incompatibility AT subset_mask

                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        SET full_mask TO TWO RAISED TO THE POWER OF n MINUS one  
        IF dp AT position full_mask IS NOT EQUAL TO infinity THEN  
            RETURN dp AT position full_mask  
        ELSE  
            RETURN negative one  
        END IF

            END WHILE

                SET resultMax TO currSum  
            END IF  
            SET rightPtr TO rightPtr + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN resultMax

    FUNCTION maximumGood(statements)

                    REPEAT UNTIL innerIdx = n OR NOT isConsistent
                        LET statementValue BE statements[idx][innerIdx]
                        IF (statementValue = 0 AND truthful[innerIdx] = TRUE) OR (statementValue = 1 AND deceitful[innerIdx] = TRUE) THEN
                            isConsistent ← FALSE
                        END IF
                        innerIdx ← innerIdx + 1
                    END REPEAT
                END IF
                idx ← idx + 1
            END WHILE
            IF isConsistent THEN
                LET countTruthful BE 0
                FOR countIdx FROM 0 TO n - 1
                    IF truthful[countIdx] = TRUE THEN
                        countTruthful ← countTruthful + 1
                    END IF
                END FOR
                IF countTruthful > maximumCount THEN
                    maximumCount ← countTruthful
                END IF
            END IF
            mask ← mask + 1
        END WHILE
        RETURN maximumCount
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maximumGood(statements)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF statements  
        SET max_good TO zero  
        FOR i FROM zero TO the NUMBER ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY n MINUS one  
            SET good TO a LIST OF n ELEMENTS EACH SET TO FALSE  
            SET bad TO a LIST OF n ELEMENTS EACH SET TO FALSE  
            FOR j FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
                IF the BITWISE AND of i AND the NUMBER ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY j EQUALS the NUMBER ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY j  
                    SET the element at position j of good TO TRUE  
                ELSE  
                    SET the element at position j of bad TO TRUE  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            SET valid TO TRUE  
            FOR j FROM zero TO n MINUS one WHILE valid HOLDS  
                IF the element at position j of good EQUALS TRUE  
                    FOR k FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
                        IF the element at position j of statements AT position k EQUALS zero AND the element at position k of good EQUALS TRUE OR the element at position j of statements AT position k EQUALS one AND the element at position k of bad EQUALS TRUE  
                            SET valid TO FALSE  
                            BREAK the inner FOR loop  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            IF valid EQUALS TRUE  
                SET max_good TO the GREATER OF max_good AND the SUM OF elements in good WHERE each TRUE IS COUNTED AS one AND each FALSE AS zero  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN max_good  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION appealSum(s)
        DECLARE lastIndices AS list WITH size 26 INITIALIZED BY -1 REPEATEDLY
        DECLARE sumOfAppeals AS 0
        DECLARE currentValue AS 0
        DECLARE pos AS 0
        WHILE pos < LENGTH(s)
            DECLARE character AS s[pos]
            DECLARE letterIndex AS (ORD(character) - ORD('a'))
            DECLARE contribution AS (pos - lastIndices[letterIndex])
            currentValue ← currentValue + contribution
            sumOfAppeals ← sumOfAppeals + currentValue
            lastIndices[letterIndex] ← pos
            pos ← pos + 1
        END WHILE
        RETURN sumOfAppeals
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION numFriendRequests(ages)
        FUNCTION request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)
            IF age_y <= (age_x / 2 + 7) THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE IF age_y > age_x THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE IF (age_y > 100) AND (age_x < 100) THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE
                RETURN true
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        SET tally TO dictionary()
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(ages)
            IF ages[idx] IN tally THEN
                tally[ages[idx]] = tally[ages[idx]] + 1
            ELSE
                tally[ages[idx]] = 1
            END IF
            idx = idx + 1
        END WHILE

        SET accumulated TO 0
        SET p_age_x TO 1
        WHILE p_age_x <= 120
            SET p_age_y TO 1
            WHILE p_age_y <= 120
                IF request_will_be_sent(p_age_x, p_age_y) THEN
                    IF p_age_x = p_age_y THEN
                        accumulated = accumulated + (tally.get(p_age_x, 0) * (tally.get(p_age_y, 0) - 1))
                    ELSE
                        accumulated = accumulated + (tally.get(p_age_x, 0) * tally.get(p_age_y, 0))
                    END IF
                END IF
                p_age_y = p_age_y + 1
            END WHILE
            p_age_x = p_age_x + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulated
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numFriendRequests(ages)  
        FUNCTION request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)  
            RETURN NOT (age_y IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO age_x MULTIPLIED BY one half PLUS seven OR age_y IS GREATER THAN age_x OR age_y IS GREATER THAN one hundred AND age_x IS LESS THAN one hundred)  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET count TO list of zero repeated one hundred and twenty one times  
        FOR each age IN ages  
            INCREMENT element at position age of count BY one  
        END FOR  

        SET total_requests TO zero  
        FOR age_x FROM one TO one hundred and twenty  
            FOR age_y FROM one TO one hundred and twenty  
                IF request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)  
                    INCREMENT total_requests BY element at position age_x of count MULTIPLIED BY element at position age_y of count MINUS one IF age_x EQUALS age_y ELSE element at position age_y of count  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        RETURN total_requests  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION pacificAtlantic WITH PARAMETER heights
        FUNCTION bfs WITH PARAMETERS q AND vis
            ASSIGN m TO LENGTH OF heights
            ASSIGN n TO LENGTH OF heights[0]
            DEFINE directions AS LIST OF PAIRS: (-1, 0), (1, 0), (0, 1), (0, -1)
            
            WHILE LENGTH OF q IS GREATER THAN 0
                ASSIGN count TO LENGTH OF q
                ASSIGN idx TO 0
                WHILE idx IS LESS THAN count
                    REMOVE THE LEFTMOST ELEMENT FROM q AND ASSIGN IT TO pos
                    ASSIGN i TO pos[0]
                    ASSIGN j TO pos[1]
                    
                    ASSIGN d_idx TO 0
                    WHILE d_idx IS LESS THAN LENGTH OF directions
                        ASSIGN delta TO directions[d_idx]
                        ASSIGN x TO i + delta[0]
                        ASSIGN y TO j + delta[1]
                        
                        IF x >= 0 AND x < m AND y >= 0 AND y < n AND NOT (x, y) IN vis AND heights[x][y] >= heights[i][j]
                            ADD (x, y) TO vis
                            ADD (x, y) TO RIGHT OF q
                        ENDIF
                        
                        INCREMENT d_idx BY 1
                    END WHILE
                    
                    INCREMENT idx BY 1
                END WHILE
            END WHILE
        END FUNCTION
        
        ASSIGN m TO LENGTH OF heights
        ASSIGN n TO LENGTH OF heights[0]
        INITIALIZE vis1 TO AN EMPTY SET
        INITIALIZE vis2 TO AN EMPTY SET
        INITIALIZE q1 TO AN EMPTY DEQUE
        INITIALIZE q2 TO AN EMPTY DEQUE
        
        ASSIGN row TO 0
        WHILE row < m
            ASSIGN col TO 0
            WHILE col < n
                IF row = 0 OR col = 0
                    ADD (row, col) TO vis1
                    ADD (row, col) TO RIGHT OF q1
                ENDIF
                
                IF row = m - 1 OR col = n - 1
                    ADD (row, col) TO vis2
                    ADD (row, col) TO RIGHT OF q2
                ENDIF
                
                INCREMENT col BY 1
            END WHILE
            INCREMENT row BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        CALL bfs WITH q1 AND vis1
        CALL bfs WITH q2 AND vis2
        
        INITIALIZE result TO AN EMPTY LIST
        
        ASSIGN r_idx TO 0
        WHILE r_idx < m
            ASSIGN c_idx TO 0
            WHILE c_idx < n
                ASSIGN pos TO (r_idx, c_idx)
                IF pos IN vis1 AND pos IN vis2
                    ADD pos TO result
                ENDIF
                INCREMENT c_idx BY 1
            END WHILE
            INCREMENT r_idx BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        RETURN result
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION pacificAtlantic WITH PARAMETER heights  
        FUNCTION bfs WITH PARAMETERS q AND vis  
            WHILE the LENGTH OF q is greater than zero  
                FOR each element from zero TO the LENGTH OF q MINUS one  
                    SET i TO the first element of the element at position zero of q removed from the front  
                    SET j TO the second element of the element at position zero of q removed from the front  
                    FOR each pair a and b IN the list of pairs where the pairs are zero and MINUS one, zero and one, one and zero, MINUS one and zero  
                        SET x TO i PLUS a  
                        SET y TO j PLUS b  
                        IF x GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND x LESS THAN m AND y GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND y LESS THAN n AND the tuple consisting of x and y is NOT IN vis AND the element at position x of heights AT position y OF heights GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the element at position i of heights AT position j OF heights  
                            ADD the tuple consisting of x and y TO vis  
                            APPEND the tuple consisting of x and y TO the end of q  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END FOR  
            END WHILE  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET m TO the LENGTH OF heights  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF the element at position zero of heights  
        SET vis1 TO an empty set  
        SET vis2 TO an empty set  
        SET q1 TO an empty double ended queue  
        SET q2 TO an empty double ended queue  
        FOR i FROM zero TO m MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
                IF i EQUALS zero OR j EQUALS zero  
                    ADD the tuple consisting of i and j TO vis1  
                    APPEND the tuple consisting of i and j TO the end of q1  
                END IF  
                IF i EQUALS m MINUS one OR j EQUALS n MINUS one  
                    ADD the tuple consisting of i and j TO vis2  
                    APPEND the tuple consisting of i and j TO the end of q2  
                END IF

        END FOR

    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numDistinctIslands2(grid)  
        FUNCTION dfs(x, y, island)  
            IF NOT (0 <= x AND x < LENGTH of grid AND 0 <= y AND y < LENGTH of grid at 0) OR grid at x, y EQUALS 0 THEN  
                EXIT FUNCTION  
            END IF  
            ASSIGN 0 TO grid at x, y  
            INSERT (x, y) INTO island  
            CALL dfs(x + 1, y, island)  
            CALL dfs(x - 1, y, island)  
            CALL dfs(x, y + 1, island)  
            CALL dfs(x, y - 1, island)  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION normalize(island)  
            ASSIGN empty array TO shapes  
            DEFINE transforms AS [(1, 1), (1, -1), (-1, 1), (-1, -1)]  
            SET idx TO 0  
            WHILE idx < LENGTH of transforms DO  
                ASSIGN empty array TO temp_island  
                LET dx, dy BE transforms at idx  
                LET v TO 0  
                WHILE v < LENGTH of island DO  
                    LET px, py BE island at v  
                    INSERT (px * dx, py * dy) INTO temp_island  
                    INCREMENT v BY 1  
                END WHILE  
                SORT temp_island by ascending order  
                LET min_x BE temp_island at 0, 0  
                LET min_y BE temp_island at 0, 1  
                LET k BE 1  
                WHILE k < LENGTH of temp_island DO  
                    IF temp_island at k, 0 < min_x THEN  
                        ASSIGN temp_island at k, 0 TO min_x  
                    END IF  
                    IF temp_island at k, 1 < min_y THEN  
                        ASSIGN temp_island at k, 1 TO min_y  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT k BY 1  
                END WHILE  
                LET normalized_shape BE empty list  
                LET m TO 0  
                WHILE m < LENGTH of temp_island DO  
                    LET cx, cy BE temp_island at m  
                    INSERT (cx - min_x, cy - min_y) INTO normalized_shape  
                    INCREMENT m BY 1  
                END WHILE  
                INSERT TUPLE OF normalized_shape INTO shapes  
                INCREMENT idx BY 1  
            END WHILE  

            LET original_cnt BE LENGTH of shapes  
            LET r TO 0  
            WHILE r < original_cnt DO  
                LET shape BE shapes at r  
                LET rotated_shape BE empty list  
                LET s TO 0  
                WHILE s < LENGTH of shape DO  
                    LET ox, oy BE shape at s  
                    INSERT (oy, -ox) INTO rotated_shape  
                    INCREMENT s BY 1  
                END WHILE  
                INSERT TUPLE OF rotated_shape INTO shapes  
                INCREMENT r BY 1  
            END WHILE  

            RETURN MINIMUM element IN shapes by lex order  
        END FUNCTION  

        ASSIGN empty set TO islands  
        LET i_iter BE 0  
        WHILE i_iter < LENGTH of grid DO  
            LET j_iter BE 0  
            WHILE j_iter < LENGTH of grid at 0 DO  
                IF grid at i_iter, j_iter EQUALS 1 THEN  
                    ASSIGN empty array TO island  
                    CALL dfs(i_iter, j_iter, island)  
                    ADD normalize(island) TO islands  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT j_iter BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT i_iter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN LENGTH of islands  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numDistinctIslands2(grid)  
        FUNCTION dfs(x, y, island)  
            IF x LESS THAN zero OR x GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO LENGTH OF grid OR y LESS THAN zero OR y GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid OR element at position x of grid at position y EQUALS zero  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            SET element at position x of grid at position y TO zero  
            APPEND tuple of x and y TO island  
            CALL dfs WITH x PLUS one AND y AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x MINUS one AND y AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x AND y PLUS one AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x AND y MINUS one AND island  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION normalize(island)  
            SET shapes TO empty list  
            FOR each pair dx and dy IN list of pairs of one and one PLUS one and minus one PLUS minus one and one PLUS minus one and minus one  
                SET new_island TO empty list  
                FOR each pair x and y IN island  
                    APPEND tuple of x MULTIPLIED BY dx AND y MULTIPLIED BY dy TO new_island  
                END FOR  
                SORT new_island in ascending order  
                SET min_x TO the minimum x among all pairs in new_island  
                SET min_y TO the minimum y among all pairs in new_island  
                APPEND tuple of pairs where each x MINUS min_x AND each y MINUS min_y from new_island TO shapes  
            END FOR  
            SET original_length TO LENGTH OF shapes  
            FOR index FROM zero TO original_length MINUS one  
                APPEND tuple of pairs where y AND negative x from shape at position index TO shapes  
            END FOR  
            RETURN the minimal element in shapes according to lexicographical order  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET islands TO empty set  
        FOR i FROM zero TO LENGTH OF grid MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid MINUS one  
                IF element at position i of grid at position j EQUALS one  
                    SET island TO empty list  
                    CALL dfs WITH i AND j AND island  
                    ADD normalize of island TO islands  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        RETURN LENGTH OF islands  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
